The intern reused a prime when setting up RSA keys. Can you decrypt the secret message? Ciphertext: 1994219723649875847959512052320558461432451480276133780853553681216922981934152458518925321254907541755676722663969800662368693003488513716474440341229397

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7512802333181701445324945996450597751426127378949792514273980081685327032362865999177710472802829450453372390232838454816696864886387554664304328634987569, e=1777993518143267512365453081301745870122667111124508500373608816812982736986479009331494847177409114380006285544880395145255103759195945920983690697417875

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{3uo4ca6i}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1994219723649875847959512052320558461432451480276133780853553681216922981934152458518925321254907541755676722663969800662368693003488513716474440341229397
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7512802333181701445324945996450597751426127378949792514273980081685327032362865999177710472802829450453372390232838454816696864886387554664304328634987569, e=1777993518143267512365453081301745870122667111124508500373608816812982736986479009331494847177409114380006285544880395145255103759195945920983690697417875
extra_info: p=86676423167904785463590998759120912196264641342174218167818714531596412270087, q=86676423167904785463590998759120912196264641342174218167818714531596412270087, Ï†(n)=7512802333181701445324945996450597751426127378949792514273980081685327032362692646331374663231902268455854148408445925534012516450051917235241135810447396
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
archetype: rsa
